inclusion.criterion: Patients must have documented hemoglobin S-only, S-beta-thalassemia, or other sickle cell disease genotype.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients must have relatively well preserved renal and hepatic function (creatinine less than 1.6 mg/dl and normal liver function test less than 5 X normal ALT).
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Evidence of severe sickle cell anemia will include one or more of the following: recurrent pain crisis (greater than or equal to 2 ER visits per year), recurrent acute chest syndrome (a lung problem like pneumonia), hospitalizations, leg ulceration, priapism, aseptic necrosis of the hip, and/or pulmonary hypertension.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients must be able to provide informed consent.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients who have hemoglobin S and A (trait) or hemoglobin A-only (non-sickle cell).
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients must not be on a chronic transfusion program, defined as regular transfusions every 2-8 weeks.
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients must not be pregnant or breast feeding.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients on chronic nitrates, such as nitroglycerin.
exclusion.label: met

notes: Patient has multifactorial chronic hypoxemia and dyspnea thought due to diastolic CHF, pulmonary hypertension thought secondary to a chronic ASD and COPD on 5L home oxygen. Pulmonary consult recommended an empiric, compassionate sildenafil trial due to severe dyspneic symptomology preventing outpatient living.
